medical_history.chief_complaint: Axial lateralization to the left and significant painless asymmetry at the level of the shoulder girdle.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms were noted after surgery for Chiari malformation type I. Following surgery, the patient developed meningitis and was hospitalized. One month post-surgery, there was a noted reduction of the syringomyelic cavity to 5 mm; however, the scoliotic posture persisted with a final angle of 31Â°.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of Chiari malformation type I and meningitis post-surgery.
